column4: i typed export "http_proxy=" in a terminal, and then did apt-get update
since then, my graphical synaptic tells me that some updates are available (for openoffice.org and so on)
but when it tries to connect to internet to get the packages, the error is "403 forbidden"
sounds like proxyerror
i don't need a proxy where i am right now
so start apt in a shell with no set proxy?
execute the command once in 2 seconds :)
i did that, but my apt didn't install the updates
did u update before upgrading?

i did a lot of things lately... 0)starting with a fully working 8.04 ubuntu+kde3.5 1)update of 8.04 2)upgrade to 8.10 3)be afraid of kde4 4)trying to get back to kde3 (not possible under 8.10) 5)installing back 8.04 from a live cd and keeping my /home 6)facing a lot of problems with my internet connection...
gnome>kde :D   but anyway, do aptitude update then upgrade and see if it works
that wont upgrade you to ibex
as long as you use the right/original sources
anything more than this?
like a few more lines of the console....
doing the upgrade right now
the upgrade is working just fine, thanks for telling me that it wouldn't upgrade to ibex :)
u r welcome :)
btw, i think best practice is using "save-upgrade"... just for future use....
does it save the current settings just in case?
it just upgrades packets taht you already have on your systems to more recent version, and only breakes packeges once in a while :D
ok, thanks, i take good note of this, save-upgrade :)
safe, not save
